cards.definition: used to say that you think that something is probably true.
cards.usage: Presumably this is where the accident happened.

cards.definition: not large, strong or important enough for a particular purpose.
cards.usage: His salary is insufficient to meet his needs.

cards.definition: more than is needed or wanted.
cards.usage: She gave him a look that made words superfluous.

cards.definition: the state of having more than one possible meaning.
cards.usage: There was considerable ambiguity in what she said.

cards.definition: the fact that something does not match something else.
cards.usage: There is some inconsistency between the witnesses' evidence.

cards.definition: an unreasonable dislike or preference for a person or group.
cards.usage: Their decision was based on ignorance and prejudice.

cards.definition: including all, or almost all, the items or information.
cards.usage: We offer a comprehensive range of goods and services.

cards.definition: that cannot be proved wrong.
cards.usage: They put forward irrefutable arguments.

cards.definition: not having the necessary skills or experience for a job.
cards.usage: He is totally unqualified for this position.

cards.definition: so interesting that you give it all your attention.
cards.usage: An engrossing book kept me up all night.

cards.definition: able to bend easily without breaking.
cards.usage: Our plans need to be flexible enough to cater for the needs of everyone.

cards.definition: an official order or commission to do something.
cards.usage: The UN had a mandate to protect civilians during the war.

cards.definition: that makes you pay attention because it is interesting or exciting.
cards.usage: Her latest book makes compelling reading.

cards.definition: having a lot of money and a good standard of living.
cards.usage: Affluent families tend to live in the suburbs.

cards.definition: a lack of something that is necessary.
cards.usage: Vitamin deficiency can cause illness.

cards.definition: able to be maintained at a certain rate or level.
cards.usage: Sustainable development is key to environmental protection.

cards.definition: the state of keeping or being kept secret or private.
cards.usage: All staff must respect client confidentiality.

cards.definition: connected with principles of what is right and wrong.
cards.usage: Ethical issues surrounding genetic research are being debated.

cards.definition: fair and reasonable.
cards.usage: We need a more equitable distribution of wealth.

cards.definition: the body's ability to avoid or fight a particular infection or disease.
cards.usage: The vaccine provides immunity against the disease.

cards.definition: attracting your interest or attention because of some unusual feature.
cards.usage: She bears a striking resemblance to her mother.

cards.definition: the history, traditions, and qualities that a country or society has had for many years.
cards.usage: The building is part of our national heritage.

cards.definition: the process of knowing, understanding and learning something.
cards.usage: Cognition and language development are closely related.

cards.definition: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way.
cards.usage: You must follow the normal procedure.

cards.definition: the hard work and effort that somebody puts into an activity.
cards.usage: She shows great dedication to her work.

cards.definition: having a good effect.
cards.usage: A balanced diet is beneficial to health.

cards.definition: having many small parts put together in a complicated way.
cards.usage: The intricate patterns on the walls fascinated me.

cards.definition: needing a lot of effort, skill, hard work or attention.
cards.usage: The job is physically demanding.

cards.definition: the act of putting money into something to make a profit.
cards.usage: This project is a good investment of our time.

cards.definition: something that is given to a person or an organization to help them.
cards.usage: We received a generous donation from the company.

cards.definition: helping poor people, especially by giving them money.
cards.usage: The organization depends on philanthropic donations.

cards.definition: knowing that something exists and is important.
cards.usage: Public awareness of environmental issues is growing.

cards.definition: the act of working together with another person or group.
cards.usage: Collaboration between the two companies resulted in a successful product.

cards.definition: the ability to become strong after something bad happens.
cards.usage: Her resilience helped her recover from the injury.

cards.definition: a very strong feeling of liking or love for something.
cards.usage: She has a passion for music.

cards.definition: being involved with something.
cards.usage: Their engagement with the local community is impressive.

cards.definition: the quality of behaving like an adult in a way that is sensible.
cards.usage: His maturity is beyond his years.

cards.definition: the state of being steady and not changing.
cards.usage: We need economic stability to grow as a nation.

cards.definition: a great change in conditions, ways of working, beliefs, etc.
cards.usage: The French Revolution marked the end of absolute monarchy.

cards.definition: the state of being free from danger or threat.
cards.usage: There are concerns over national security.

cards.definition: the skill of choosing the right moment to do or say something.
cards.usage: The timing of the announcement was perfect.

cards.definition: a statement about what will happen in the future.
cards.usage: Their prediction of a rise in sales was accurate.

cards.definition: a new plan for dealing with a particular problem.
cards.usage: We launched an initiative to improve education.

cards.definition: a strong feeling of wanting something or someone.
cards.usage: She had a deep yearning for her home.

cards.definition: an amount of something that is provided or available to be used.
cards.usage: The water supply was cut off during the repairs.

cards.definition: a time when a particular situation makes it possible to do or achieve something.
cards.usage: This is a great opportunity to advance your career.

cards.definition: the act of making parts of something work together in an efficient and organized way.
cards.usage: Coordination between different departments is essential for success.

cards.definition: to make something less harmful, serious, etc.
cards.usage: Measures need to be taken to mitigate the effects of climate change.

cards.definition: that cannot be avoided or prevented from happening.
cards.usage: It was inevitable that his decision would upset some people.

cards.definition: existing or happening over a wide area or among many people.
cards.usage: These diseases are more prevalent among young children.
